reviewText: Kids loved the movie, its CGI was ok, but had some great funny moments for the whole family to enjoy

Tom (Milo Parker) a misunderstood child teams up with a fired ghost hunter Ms. Cuminseed (Anke Engelke) and a friendly green slime ghost (Bastian Pastewka voice) to go after a large ancient icy ghost and save the world...sort of like "Ghost Busters" but not as good.

While the acting was bad, I am sure the kids will enjoy the banter between bother and sister, the ghost, and a child trying to be accepted in an adult world. Tom is mature for his age.

On the negative side, and correct me if I am wrong, but wasn't that an F-bomb used near the end of the film borrowed from Bruce Willis film that starts out "Yippee ki-yay..."

This movie was the perfect amount of "scary" for kids that they felt they were watching a scary movie without being so terrifying I'm nervous they are not going to sleep for weeks. Even the scariest ghost - not so scary. My only REAL complaint about this movie is the use of the word "ass" - it's used about a dozen times. Sometimes as they reference it (one sequence is 4 or five times in a minute) - they are referencing someone's behind. The other times it's like, "Don't make an ass of yourself." My 4 and 6 year old children don't know that word and they didn't ask but after repeated use, I did tell them, "That's actually not a nice word and it means butt but we don't use it." I did still give the movie 5 stars at the request of my 6 year old.
